bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Goerge L. Rives, March 31, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, March 21st 1888
Instruction to means Bericaba of Accts General
Mr B. Y. Payne to the Assistant Secretary of State

Sir. I have the honor to respectfully transmit the following as my returns or repeat my in cumbency October 1887 to State, which consist of DIgest of Invoices book of Arrivals and departures of American vessels (2) ~ Summary of Consular business (3) Records of official official
Official fees (4), Miscelleneous expenses with vouchers (5) and General, account (6)

Permit me to express my deep regret that I have not forwarded these returns in regular order (quarterly): My reason for not doing so, was that Mr. Taylor requested me not to, until his return, which would have been before the ending of December quarter, last, according to his arrangement, and not until I had entered upon the quarter ending this date did I hear of his resignation did forwarded my Bond.
I have put no house house
rent in the account, but there is one quarter Mr Sharp, to date: having no authority to settle same. I have requested him to await until I can get advice in reference to the matter.

I have further to state in explanation of my account record, that the bill of Mr. R. A. Sherman, is for landing the case Stationary to consigned to the Legation when Mr. Taylor was in charge, which was claimed to the Leeward, and landed a few days after Mr Taylor's departure. The Bill of Messers G. Moore & Son is for whichever necessary to be be
be had for the cleanliness of, and light for safety of the Legation. The two boys Thomas Robeik, and Wanjeh Lan's were left at the Legation by Mr. Taylor.
I trust my report will be in order and satisfactory, as Mr. Taylor left the Legation to return in two and a half months, and matter very scattered and aukward.
I have the honor to be Sir Your very obedient Servant
Hon George L. Rives Ass't Sec'y State
Enclosures. Digest of Invoices book. Arrivals & Departure of vessels. Summary of Consular business Record of official fees. Miscelleneous expense with vouchers & General Ac
